title: Imposing Additional Sanctions With Respect to North Korea

enrichment.summary: This executive order imposes additional economic sanctions on North Korea by blocking property and restricting transactions involving persons and entities connected to North Korea’s nuclear and missile programs. It also bans the entry of certain individuals involved in these activities and restricts U.S. ports to vessels and aircraft linked to North Korea, aiming to pressure North Korea to halt its destabilizing behaviors.
potential_concerns: The expanded sanctions could significantly disrupt North Korean nationals' ability to engage in international travel and commerce, impacting visa holders and foreign nationals connected to sanctioned entities.

Restrictions on vessels and aircraft linked to North Korea may adversely affect maritime port workers and airline/aviation workers in the United States due to reduced traffic and operational challenges.

Blocking property and freezing transactions involving entities connected to North Korea may harm legitimate corporations and financial services workers who operate in or with regions indirectly linked to North Korea-related activities, risking over-compliance or undue business restrictions.

The travel bans and sanctions may unintentionally impact lawful visa holders (such as students, workers, and tourists) from North Korea who are not involved in prohibited activities, raising concerns about fairness and due process.

The order’s rigorous enforcement might increase compliance costs and complicate transactions for global financial institutions, which could indirectly burden financial services workers and increase systemic risk in sectors unrelated to North Korea.
